trans-unit.source: Reader
trans-unit.target: Reader

trans-unit.source: Loads data from external sources on the web and from various forms of cloud-based storage in Azure such as tables, blobs, and SQL Server databases
trans-unit.target: Loads data from external sources on the web and from various forms of cloud-based storage in Azure such as tables, blobs, and SQL Server databases

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="F1050CE4-218A-4304-A4A7-57832BE4CDE0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Data Input and Output</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="F1050CE4-218A-4304-A4A7-57832BE4CDE0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Data Input and Output</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Reader</ui> module to load data into an experiment from data management services outside Azure Machine Learning Studio.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Reader</ui> module to load data into an experiment from data management services outside Azure Machine Learning Studio.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Reader</ui> uses this data to create a dataset that can be connected to any other module that supports a dataset on the input port.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Reader</ui> uses this data to create a dataset that can be connected to any other module that supports a dataset on the input port.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Reader</ui> supports the following data sources:
trans-unit.target: <ui>Reader</ui> supports the following data sources:

trans-unit.source: Web URL via HTTP
trans-unit.target: Web URL via HTTP

trans-unit.source: Reads data in CSV, TSV, ARFF, and SvmLight formats, from any web URL that uses HTTP.
trans-unit.target: Reads data in CSV, TSV, ARFF, and SvmLight formats, from any web URL that uses HTTP.

trans-unit.source: Hive Query
trans-unit.target: Hive Query

trans-unit.source: Reads data from distributed storage in Hadoop.
trans-unit.target: Reads data from distributed storage in Hadoop.

trans-unit.source: You specify the data you want by using HiveQL.
trans-unit.target: You specify the data you want by using HiveQL.

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database

trans-unit.source: Reads data that is stored in SQL databases in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Reads data that is stored in SQL databases in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Storage in a SQL database is more expensive than using tables or blobs in Azure, and there may be limits on the amount of data that you can store in a database.
trans-unit.target: Storage in a SQL database is more expensive than using tables or blobs in Azure, and there may be limits on the amount of data that you can store in a database.

trans-unit.source: However, there are no transaction fees against SQL databases, so they are ideal for fast access to smaller amounts of frequently used information, such as data lookup tables or data dictionaries.
trans-unit.target: However, there are no transaction fees against SQL databases, so they are ideal for fast access to smaller amounts of frequently used information, such as data lookup tables or data dictionaries.

trans-unit.source: Azure Table
trans-unit.target: Azure Table

trans-unit.source: Reads data from the Table service in Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: Reads data from the Table service in Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: If you infrequently read large amounts of data, use the Azure Table Service.
trans-unit.target: If you infrequently read large amounts of data, use the Azure Table Service.

trans-unit.source: It provides a flexible, non-relational (NoSQL), massively-scalable, inexpensive, and highly available storage solution.
trans-unit.target: It provides a flexible, non-relational (NoSQL), massively-scalable, inexpensive, and highly available storage solution.

trans-unit.source: Azure Blob Storage
trans-unit.target: Azure Blob Storage

trans-unit.source: Reads data stored in the Blob service in Azure Storage, including images, unstructured text, or binary data.
trans-unit.target: Reads data stored in the Blob service in Azure Storage, including images, unstructured text, or binary data.

trans-unit.source: You can use the Blob service to publicly expose data, or to privately store application data.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Blob service to publicly expose data, or to privately store application data.

trans-unit.source: You can access your data from anywhere by using HTTP or HTTPS connections.
trans-unit.target: You can access your data from anywhere by using HTTP or HTTPS connections.

trans-unit.source: Data Feed Provider
trans-unit.target: Data Feed Provider

trans-unit.source: Reads data from any supported feed provider.
trans-unit.target: Reads data from any supported feed provider.

trans-unit.source: When you load data, <ui>Reader</ui> infers the data type of each column based on the values it contains, either numerical or categorical.
trans-unit.target: When you load data, <ui>Reader</ui> infers the data type of each column based on the values it contains, either numerical or categorical.

trans-unit.source: If a header is present, the header is used to name the columns of the output dataset.
trans-unit.target: If a header is present, the header is used to name the columns of the output dataset.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure Reader
trans-unit.target: How to Configure Reader

trans-unit.source: The options for <ui>Reader</ui> are dynamic, and multiple options are available depending on the source of your data and whether authentication is required.
trans-unit.target: The options for <ui>Reader</ui> are dynamic, and multiple options are available depending on the source of your data and whether authentication is required.

trans-unit.source: Web URL via HTTP
trans-unit.target: Web URL via HTTP

trans-unit.source: Use this option to read data from any web URL over HTTP.
trans-unit.target: Use this option to read data from any web URL over HTTP.

trans-unit.source: URL
trans-unit.target: URL

trans-unit.source: Specify the full name of the file, including the site URL and the file name you want to read, with any extension, For example:
trans-unit.target: Specify the full name of the file, including the site URL and the file name you want to read, with any extension, For example:

trans-unit.source: Data format
trans-unit.target: Data format

trans-unit.source: The supported data formats are CSV, TSV, ARFF, and SvmLight.
trans-unit.target: The supported data formats are CSV, TSV, ARFF, and SvmLight.

trans-unit.source: If the data has a header row, it is used to assign column names.
trans-unit.target: If the data has a header row, it is used to assign column names.

trans-unit.source: Hive Query
trans-unit.target: Hive Query

trans-unit.source: Use this option to read data from distributed storage by specifying data using HiveQL, a SQL-like query language.
trans-unit.target: Use this option to read data from distributed storage by specifying data using HiveQL, a SQL-like query language.

trans-unit.source: HiveQL can also be used to aggregate data and perform data filtering before you add the data to Machine Learning Studio.
trans-unit.target: HiveQL can also be used to aggregate data and perform data filtering before you add the data to Machine Learning Studio.

trans-unit.source: To define the data for input, set the following parameters to identify the source and the HiveQL query:
trans-unit.target: To define the data for input, set the following parameters to identify the source and the HiveQL query:

trans-unit.source: Hive database query
trans-unit.target: Hive database query

trans-unit.source: Type the Hive query for generating the data.
trans-unit.target: Type the Hive query for generating the data.

trans-unit.source: HCatalog server URI
trans-unit.target: HCatalog server URI

trans-unit.source: Type the name of your cluster in the format <your cluster name>.azurehdinsight.net.
trans-unit.target: Type the name of your cluster in the format <your cluster name>.azurehdinsight.net.

trans-unit.source: Hadoop user account name
trans-unit.target: Hadoop user account name

trans-unit.source: Type the Hadoop user account name that you used when you provisioned the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Type the Hadoop user account name that you used when you provisioned the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Hadoop user account password
trans-unit.target: Hadoop user account password

trans-unit.source: Type the credentials that you used when you provisioned the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Type the credentials that you used when you provisioned the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/hdinsight-provision-clusters/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/hdinsight-provision-clusters/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Location of output data
trans-unit.target: Location of output data

trans-unit.source: Specify whether the data is stored in a Hadoop distributed file system (HDFS) or in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Specify whether the data is stored in a Hadoop distributed file system (HDFS) or in Azure.

trans-unit.source: HDFS
trans-unit.target: HDFS

trans-unit.source: To obtain the data to read from HDFS, specify the HDFS server URI.
trans-unit.target: To obtain the data to read from HDFS, specify the HDFS server URI.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to use the HDInsight cluster name without the HTTPS:// prefix.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to use the HDInsight cluster name without the HTTPS:// prefix.

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: If you store your data in Azure, you must specify the following:
trans-unit.target: If you store your data in Azure, you must specify the following:

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage account name
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage account name

trans-unit.source: Use the account that was used to provision the Hadoop cluster.
trans-unit.target: Use the account that was used to provision the Hadoop cluster.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage access key
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage access key

trans-unit.source: Copy and paste the key that is provided for accessing the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Copy and paste the key that is provided for accessing the storage account.

trans-unit.source: If you don’t have an access key, see <externalLink><linkText>How to regenerate storage access keys</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/storage-manage-storage-account/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: If you don’t have an access key, see <externalLink><linkText>How to regenerate storage access keys</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/storage-manage-storage-account/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage container name
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage container name

trans-unit.source: You must use the <legacyBold>default container</legacyBold> of the cluster.
trans-unit.target: You must use the <legacyBold>default container</legacyBold> of the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Typically, you use the default settings to create a container when you provision a cluster.
trans-unit.target: Typically, you use the default settings to create a container when you provision a cluster.

trans-unit.source: If you created your cluster by using the default settings, a container with the same name as the cluster is created.
trans-unit.target: If you created your cluster by using the default settings, a container with the same name as the cluster is created.

trans-unit.source: This is the storage container name for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: This is the storage container name for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: However, if you created your cluster by using the <ui>CUSTOM CREATE</ui> option, you were given two options for selecting the default container:
trans-unit.target: However, if you created your cluster by using the <ui>CUSTOM CREATE</ui> option, you were given two options for selecting the default container:

trans-unit.source: If you selected an existing container, it is used as the storage container name for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: If you selected an existing container, it is used as the storage container name for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: If you used the <ui>Create default container</ui> option, a container with the same name as the cluster is created, and this will be the storage container name for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: If you used the <ui>Create default container</ui> option, a container with the same name as the cluster is created, and this will be the storage container name for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database

trans-unit.source: Use this option to read data from a SQL database in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Use this option to read data from a SQL database in Azure.

trans-unit.source: To define the data to use in Studio, you must specify the database in addition to a SQL query.
trans-unit.target: To define the data to use in Studio, you must specify the database in addition to a SQL query.

trans-unit.source: Database server name
trans-unit.target: Database server name

trans-unit.source: Type the server name that is generated by Azure.
trans-unit.target: Type the server name that is generated by Azure.

trans-unit.source: Typically it has the form <codeInline>%%amp;lt;generated_identifier%%amp;gt;.database.windows.net</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Typically it has the form <codeInline>%%amp;lt;generated_identifier%%amp;gt;.database.windows.net</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Database name
trans-unit.target: Database name

trans-unit.source: Type the name of a database on the server you just specified.
trans-unit.target: Type the name of a database on the server you just specified.

trans-unit.source: Server user account name
trans-unit.target: Server user account name

trans-unit.source: Type the user name of an account that has access permissions for the database.
trans-unit.target: Type the user name of an account that has access permissions for the database.

trans-unit.source: Server user account password
trans-unit.target: Server user account password

trans-unit.source: Provide the password for the specified user account.
trans-unit.target: Provide the password for the specified user account.

trans-unit.source: Accept any server certificate
trans-unit.target: Accept any server certificate

trans-unit.source: Use this option (less secure) if you want to skip reviewing the site certificate before you read your data.
trans-unit.target: Use this option (less secure) if you want to skip reviewing the site certificate before you read your data.

trans-unit.source: Database query
trans-unit.target: Database query

trans-unit.source: Enter a SQL statement that describes the data you want to read.
trans-unit.target: Enter a SQL statement that describes the data you want to read.

trans-unit.source: Azure Table
trans-unit.target: Azure Table

trans-unit.source: Use this option to get data from a table in Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: Use this option to get data from a table in Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: The Table service is the data management service in Azure Storage that stores large amounts of structured, non-relational data.
trans-unit.target: The Table service is the data management service in Azure Storage that stores large amounts of structured, non-relational data.

trans-unit.source: The Table service is a NoSQL data store that accepts authenticated calls from inside and outside Azure.
trans-unit.target: The Table service is a NoSQL data store that accepts authenticated calls from inside and outside Azure.

trans-unit.source: The options in <ui>Reader</ui> change depending on whether you are accessing public information or a private storage account that requires login credentials.
trans-unit.target: The options in <ui>Reader</ui> change depending on whether you are accessing public information or a private storage account that requires login credentials.

trans-unit.source: Public or SAS
trans-unit.target: Public or SAS

trans-unit.source: If you want to read data from a table that is public, or by using a shared access signature (SAS) URI, you do not need additional credentials because both options contain all the information in the URL string that is needed for download and authentication.
trans-unit.target: If you want to read data from a table that is public, or by using a shared access signature (SAS) URI, you do not need additional credentials because both options contain all the information in the URL string that is needed for download and authentication.

trans-unit.source: A SAS URL is a time-bound access URL that contains all the information needed for the transfer.
trans-unit.target: A SAS URL is a time-bound access URL that contains all the information needed for the transfer.

trans-unit.source: You can generate a SAS URL for a storage account by using utilities such as Azure Storage Explorer.
trans-unit.target: You can generate a SAS URL for a storage account by using utilities such as Azure Storage Explorer.

trans-unit.source: To access the data, provide the URL as follows:
trans-unit.target: To access the data, provide the URL as follows:

trans-unit.source: Table URI
trans-unit.target: Table URI

trans-unit.source: Type the SAS URL for the table URI.
trans-unit.target: Type the SAS URL for the table URI.

trans-unit.source: Rows to scan for property names
trans-unit.target: Rows to scan for property names

trans-unit.source: Use the following options to read all rows from the data, or a partial set of rows, to generate the list of columns in the output:
trans-unit.target: Use the following options to read all rows from the data, or a partial set of rows, to generate the list of columns in the output:

trans-unit.source: <ui>TopN</ui>: Scan the specified number of rows.
trans-unit.target: <ui>TopN</ui>: Scan the specified number of rows.

trans-unit.source: <ui>ScanAll</ui>: Scan all rows in the table.
trans-unit.target: <ui>ScanAll</ui>: Scan all rows in the table.

trans-unit.source: If the data is homogenous and predictable, we recommend that you select <ui>TopN</ui> and enter a number for N. For large tables, this can result in quicker reading times.
trans-unit.target: If the data is homogenous and predictable, we recommend that you select <ui>TopN</ui> and enter a number for N. For large tables, this can result in quicker reading times.

trans-unit.source: If the data is structured with sets of properties that vary based on the depth and position of the table, choose the <ui>ScanAll</ui> option to scan all rows.
trans-unit.target: If the data is structured with sets of properties that vary based on the depth and position of the table, choose the <ui>ScanAll</ui> option to scan all rows.

trans-unit.source: This ensures the integrity of your resulting property and metadata conversion.
trans-unit.target: This ensures the integrity of your resulting property and metadata conversion.

trans-unit.source: Account
trans-unit.target: Account

trans-unit.source: To use <ui>Reader</ui> to get data from a secured table, you must provide the following information about the source, account, and credentials:
trans-unit.target: To use <ui>Reader</ui> to get data from a secured table, you must provide the following information about the source, account, and credentials:

trans-unit.source: Account name
trans-unit.target: Account name

trans-unit.source: The name of the account that contains the table you want to read.
trans-unit.target: The name of the account that contains the table you want to read.

trans-unit.source: Account key
trans-unit.target: Account key

trans-unit.source: The storage key associated with the account.
trans-unit.target: The storage key associated with the account.

trans-unit.source: Table name
trans-unit.target: Table name

trans-unit.source: The name of the table that contains the data you want to read.
trans-unit.target: The name of the table that contains the data you want to read.

trans-unit.source: Rows to scan for property names
trans-unit.target: Rows to scan for property names

trans-unit.source: Use the following options to read a partial set of rows from the data to generate the list of columns in the output:
trans-unit.target: Use the following options to read a partial set of rows from the data to generate the list of columns in the output:

trans-unit.source: <ui>TopN</ui>.
trans-unit.target: <ui>TopN</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Scan the specified number of rows
trans-unit.target: Scan the specified number of rows

trans-unit.source: <ui>ScanAll</ui>.
trans-unit.target: <ui>ScanAll</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Scan all rows in the table
trans-unit.target: Scan all rows in the table

trans-unit.source: If the data is homogenous and predictable, we recommend that you select the <ui>TopN</ui> option and enter a number for N. For large tables, this can result in quicker reading times.
trans-unit.target: If the data is homogenous and predictable, we recommend that you select the <ui>TopN</ui> option and enter a number for N. For large tables, this can result in quicker reading times.

trans-unit.source: If the data is structured with sets of properties that vary based on the depth and position of the table, choose the <ui>ScanAll</ui> option to scan all rows.
trans-unit.target: If the data is structured with sets of properties that vary based on the depth and position of the table, choose the <ui>ScanAll</ui> option to scan all rows.

trans-unit.source: This ensures the integrity of your resulting property and metadata conversion.
trans-unit.target: This ensures the integrity of your resulting property and metadata conversion.

trans-unit.source: Azure Blob Storage
trans-unit.target: Azure Blob Storage

trans-unit.source: Use this option to get data from a blob in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Use this option to get data from a blob in Azure.

trans-unit.source: The Blob service is the data management service in Azure Storage that is for storing large amounts of data that can be accessed from anywhere via HTTP or HTTPS.
trans-unit.target: The Blob service is the data management service in Azure Storage that is for storing large amounts of data that can be accessed from anywhere via HTTP or HTTPS.

trans-unit.source: The options in <ui>Reader</ui> change depending on whether you are accessing public information or a private storage account that requires login credentials.
trans-unit.target: The options in <ui>Reader</ui> change depending on whether you are accessing public information or a private storage account that requires login credentials.

trans-unit.source: Public or SAS
trans-unit.target: Public or SAS

trans-unit.source: If you read data from a blob that is public or by using a SAS URL, you do not need additional credentials because both options contain all the information in the URL string that is needed for download and authentication.
trans-unit.target: If you read data from a blob that is public or by using a SAS URL, you do not need additional credentials because both options contain all the information in the URL string that is needed for download and authentication.

trans-unit.source: Simply provide the URL and specify the format as follows:
trans-unit.target: Simply provide the URL and specify the format as follows:

trans-unit.source: URI
trans-unit.target: URI

trans-unit.source: A SAS URL is a time bound access URL that contains all the information needed for the blob transfer.
trans-unit.target: A SAS URL is a time bound access URL that contains all the information needed for the blob transfer.

trans-unit.source: You can generate a SAS URL for a storage account by using utilities such as Azure Storage Explorer.
trans-unit.target: You can generate a SAS URL for a storage account by using utilities such as Azure Storage Explorer.

trans-unit.source: File format
trans-unit.target: File format

trans-unit.source: Specify the format of the data in the Blob service.
trans-unit.target: Specify the format of the data in the Blob service.

trans-unit.source: The supported formats are CSV, TSV, and ARFF.
trans-unit.target: The supported formats are CSV, TSV, and ARFF.

trans-unit.source: Account
trans-unit.target: Account

trans-unit.source: To use <ui>Reader</ui> to get data from a secured blob, you must provide the following information:
trans-unit.target: To use <ui>Reader</ui> to get data from a secured blob, you must provide the following information:

trans-unit.source: Account name
trans-unit.target: Account name

trans-unit.source: The name of the account that contains the blob you want to access.
trans-unit.target: The name of the account that contains the blob you want to access.

trans-unit.source: Account key
trans-unit.target: Account key

trans-unit.source: The storage access key that is associated with the account.
trans-unit.target: The storage access key that is associated with the account.

trans-unit.source: Path to container, directory, or blob
trans-unit.target: Path to container, directory, or blob

trans-unit.source: The name of the blob that you want to retrieve.
trans-unit.target: The name of the blob that you want to retrieve.

trans-unit.source: Blob file format
trans-unit.target: Blob file format

trans-unit.source: Specify the format of the data in the Blob service.
trans-unit.target: Specify the format of the data in the Blob service.

trans-unit.source: The supported data formats are CSV, TSV, ARFF, CSV with a specified encoding, and Excel.
trans-unit.target: The supported data formats are CSV, TSV, ARFF, CSV with a specified encoding, and Excel.

trans-unit.source: If the format is CSV or TSV, be sure to indicate whether the file contains a header row.
trans-unit.target: If the format is CSV or TSV, be sure to indicate whether the file contains a header row.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Excel</ui> option to read data from Excel workbooks.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Excel</ui> option to read data from Excel workbooks.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Excel data format</ui> option, indicate whether the data is in an Excel worksheet range, or in an Excel table.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Excel data format</ui> option, indicate whether the data is in an Excel worksheet range, or in an Excel table.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Excel sheet or embedded table</ui> option, specify the name of the sheet or table that you want to read from.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Excel sheet or embedded table</ui> option, specify the name of the sheet or table that you want to read from.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the option, <ui>CSV with encoding</ui>, to specify these additional options:
trans-unit.target: You can also use the option, <ui>CSV with encoding</ui>, to specify these additional options:

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Comma delimiter format</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Comma delimiter format</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Choose from a list of common characters used as field separators, including the comma (,) tab character, and semicolon (;)
trans-unit.target: Choose from a list of common characters used as field separators, including the comma (,) tab character, and semicolon (;)

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic><ui>Encoding format</ui></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic><ui>Encoding format</ui></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Choose the character encoding used by the file you want to read.
trans-unit.target: Choose the character encoding used by the file you want to read.

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Notes" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section for details.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Notes" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section for details.

trans-unit.source: Data Feed Provider
trans-unit.target: Data Feed Provider

trans-unit.source: Use this option to read data from a feed using an OData URL.
trans-unit.target: Use this option to read data from a feed using an OData URL.

trans-unit.source: Data content type
trans-unit.target: Data content type

trans-unit.source: Currently only the OData format is supported.
trans-unit.target: Currently only the OData format is supported.

trans-unit.source: Source URL
trans-unit.target: Source URL

trans-unit.source: Type the full URL for the data feed.
trans-unit.target: Type the full URL for the data feed.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following URL reads from the Northwind sample database:
trans-unit.target: For example, the following URL reads from the Northwind sample database:

trans-unit.source: The query should yield a flat table.
trans-unit.target: The query should yield a flat table.

trans-unit.source: Flattening nested OData records is not currently supported.
trans-unit.target: Flattening nested OData records is not currently supported.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: For examples of how to use <ui>Reader</ui> in an experiment, see thee sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of how to use <ui>Reader</ui> in an experiment, see thee sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Download UCI Dataset</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525938</linkUri></externalLink> sample reads a dataset in the CSV format.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Download UCI Dataset</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525938</linkUri></externalLink> sample reads a dataset in the CSV format.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Dataset Processing</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525733</linkUri></externalLink> sample loads the dataset into the workspace, changes column names, and adds metadata.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Dataset Processing</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525733</linkUri></externalLink> sample loads the dataset into the workspace, changes column names, and adds metadata.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>News Categorization sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525167</linkUri></externalLink> loads and then combines multiple datasets from the Blob service in Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>News Categorization sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525167</linkUri></externalLink> loads and then combines multiple datasets from the Blob service in Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Student Performance sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525727</linkUri></externalLink> reads data that is stored in the TSV format from the Blob service in Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Student Performance sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525727</linkUri></externalLink> reads data that is stored in the TSV format from the Blob service in Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Letter Recognition sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525737</linkUri></externalLink> gets a training dataset from the public machine learning repository hosted by UC Irvine.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Letter Recognition sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525737</linkUri></externalLink> gets a training dataset from the public machine learning repository hosted by UC Irvine.

trans-unit.source: Technical Notes
trans-unit.target: Technical Notes

trans-unit.source: This section contains some advanced configuration options and answers to commonly asked questions.
trans-unit.target: This section contains some advanced configuration options and answers to commonly asked questions.

trans-unit.source: Custom Encoding for CSV Files
trans-unit.target: Custom Encoding for CSV Files

trans-unit.source: Pre-release versions of the <ui>Reader</ui> module did not support some kinds of valid CSV files.
trans-unit.target: Pre-release versions of the <ui>Reader</ui> module did not support some kinds of valid CSV files.

trans-unit.source: For example, data exported from Excel sometimes contained characters that prevented the file from parsing correctly.
trans-unit.target: For example, data exported from Excel sometimes contained characters that prevented the file from parsing correctly.

trans-unit.source: To support a wider possible range of delimiters and character formats, <ui>Reader</ui> now supports choosing the delimiter and encoding format.
trans-unit.target: To support a wider possible range of delimiters and character formats, <ui>Reader</ui> now supports choosing the delimiter and encoding format.

trans-unit.source: If you use the <ui>CSV with encoding</ui> option, the result is a more robust and efficient parsing of the CSV file.
trans-unit.target: If you use the <ui>CSV with encoding</ui> option, the result is a more robust and efficient parsing of the CSV file.

trans-unit.source: You can use the following character encodings:
trans-unit.target: You can use the following character encodings:

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.source: Encoding
trans-unit.target: Encoding

trans-unit.target: Unicode

trans-unit.target: Unicode (UTF-8)

trans-unit.target: Unicode (UTF-7)

trans-unit.source: Increasing Memory for Hive Queries
trans-unit.target: Increasing Memory for Hive Queries

trans-unit.source: When using Hive queries to extract records from big data sources, sometimes the default configuration of the Hadoop cluster is too limited to support running the MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: When using Hive queries to extract records from big data sources, sometimes the default configuration of the Hadoop cluster is too limited to support running the MapReduce job.

trans-unit.source: For example, in these <externalLink><linkText>Release Notes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/hdinsight-release-notes/</linkUri></externalLink> for HDInsight, the default settings are defined as a four-node cluster.
trans-unit.target: For example, in these <externalLink><linkText>Release Notes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/hdinsight-release-notes/</linkUri></externalLink> for HDInsight, the default settings are defined as a four-node cluster.

trans-unit.source: If the requirements of the MapReduce job exceed available capacity, the Hive queries might return an <ui>Out of Memory</ui> error message, which causes the <ui>Reader</ui> operation to fail.
trans-unit.target: If the requirements of the MapReduce job exceed available capacity, the Hive queries might return an <ui>Out of Memory</ui> error message, which causes the <ui>Reader</ui> operation to fail.

trans-unit.source: If this happens, you can change the default memory allocation for Hive queries in the <ui>Reader</ui> module, as shown here:
trans-unit.target: If this happens, you can change the default memory allocation for Hive queries in the <ui>Reader</ui> module, as shown here:

trans-unit.source: In this example, the commands <codeInline>set mapreduce.map.memory.mb</codeInline> and <codeInline>set mapreduce.reduce.memory.mb</codeInline> are used to increase the amount of memory, to use the maximum allowed in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the commands <codeInline>set mapreduce.map.memory.mb</codeInline> and <codeInline>set mapreduce.reduce.memory.mb</codeInline> are used to increase the amount of memory, to use the maximum allowed in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Using Python UDFs with Hive Query
trans-unit.target: Using Python UDFs with Hive Query

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Reader</ui> module to run Hive queries that call Python UDFs to process records.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Reader</ui> module to run Hive queries that call Python UDFs to process records.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Use Python with Hive and Pig in HDInsight</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/hdinsight-python/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Use Python with Hive and Pig in HDInsight</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/hdinsight-python/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Data Type Inference in CSV and TSV Formats
trans-unit.target: Data Type Inference in CSV and TSV Formats

trans-unit.source: <ui>Reader</ui> can load data from a CSV or TSV file in Azure blob storage.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Reader</ui> can load data from a CSV or TSV file in Azure blob storage.

trans-unit.source: When you select this option, the records and any applicable attribute headings are loaded as rows into memory as a dataset (the default storage format used in Azure Machine Learning).
trans-unit.target: When you select this option, the records and any applicable attribute headings are loaded as rows into memory as a dataset (the default storage format used in Azure Machine Learning).

trans-unit.source: A type guesser then looks for categorical or numerical data in the source file, and represents the discovered type in the metadata for the new dataset.
trans-unit.target: A type guesser then looks for categorical or numerical data in the source file, and represents the discovered type in the metadata for the new dataset.

trans-unit.source: You can override the results of the type guesser by editing the column attributes in the <link xlink:href="370b6676-c11c-486f-bf73-35349f842a66" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Metadata Editor</link> module.
trans-unit.target: You can override the results of the type guesser by editing the column attributes in the <link xlink:href="370b6676-c11c-486f-bf73-35349f842a66" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Metadata Editor</link> module.

trans-unit.source: If attribute data contains quotation marks or escaped character sequences, they are handled by using the rules for such characters in Microsoft Excel.
trans-unit.target: If attribute data contains quotation marks or escaped character sequences, they are handled by using the rules for such characters in Microsoft Excel.

trans-unit.source: All other characters are handled by using the following specifications as a guideline: <externalLink><linkText>RFC 4180</linkText><linkAlternateText>RFC 4180</linkAlternateText><linkUri>http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4180</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All other characters are handled by using the following specifications as a guideline: <externalLink><linkText>RFC 4180</linkText><linkAlternateText>RFC 4180</linkAlternateText><linkUri>http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4180</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Common Issues
trans-unit.target: Common Issues

trans-unit.source: This section lists some common questions about using <ui>Reader</ui>.
trans-unit.target: This section lists some common questions about using <ui>Reader</ui>.

trans-unit.source: How can I filter data as it is being read from the source?
trans-unit.target: How can I filter data as it is being read from the source?

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Reader</ui> module does not support filtering as data is being read.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Reader</ui> module does not support filtering as data is being read.

trans-unit.source: The exception is reading from data feeds, which sometimes allow you to specify a filter condition as part of the feed URL.
trans-unit.target: The exception is reading from data feeds, which sometimes allow you to specify a filter condition as part of the feed URL.

trans-unit.source: However, there are many ways that you can filter data before and after reading it into Azure Machine Learning Studio:
trans-unit.target: However, there are many ways that you can filter data before and after reading it into Azure Machine Learning Studio:

trans-unit.source: Read the entire dataset and then use a custom R script to get only the data you want.
trans-unit.target: Read the entire dataset and then use a custom R script to get only the data you want.

trans-unit.source: Use the <link xlink:href="70530644-c97a-4ab6-85f7-88bf30a8be5f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Split</link> module with a relative expression or a regular expression to isolate the data you want, and then save it as a dataset.
trans-unit.target: Use the <link xlink:href="70530644-c97a-4ab6-85f7-88bf30a8be5f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Split</link> module with a relative expression or a regular expression to isolate the data you want, and then save it as a dataset.

trans-unit.source: Create a view when reading from a SQL database in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Create a view when reading from a SQL database in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Use a Hive query or a MapReduce job to aggregate and transform data.
trans-unit.target: Use a Hive query or a MapReduce job to aggregate and transform data.

trans-unit.source: If you find that you have loaded more data than you need, you can overwrite the cached dataset by reading a new dataset, and saving it with the same name as the older, larger data.
trans-unit.target: If you find that you have loaded more data than you need, you can overwrite the cached dataset by reading a new dataset, and saving it with the same name as the older, larger data.

trans-unit.source: Why does <ui>Reader</ui> add an extra row at the end of my dataset when it finds a trailing new line?
trans-unit.target: Why does <ui>Reader</ui> add an extra row at the end of my dataset when it finds a trailing new line?

trans-unit.source: If the <ui>Reader</ui> module encounters a row of data that is followed by an empty line or a trailing new line character, an extra row is added at the end of the table.
trans-unit.target: If the <ui>Reader</ui> module encounters a row of data that is followed by an empty line or a trailing new line character, an extra row is added at the end of the table.

trans-unit.source: This new row contains missing values.
trans-unit.target: This new row contains missing values.

trans-unit.source: The reason for interpreting a trailing new line as a new row is that <ui>Reader</ui> cannot determine the difference between an actual empty line and an empty line that is created by the user pressing ENTER at the end of a file.
trans-unit.target: The reason for interpreting a trailing new line as a new row is that <ui>Reader</ui> cannot determine the difference between an actual empty line and an empty line that is created by the user pressing ENTER at the end of a file.

trans-unit.source: Because some machine learning algorithms support missing data and will actually treat this line as a case (which in turn would affect the results), you should use <link xlink:href="d2c5ca2f-7323-41a3-9b7e-da917c99f0c4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Clean Missing Values</link> to check for missing values (particularly rows that are completely empty), and remove them as needed.
trans-unit.target: Because some machine learning algorithms support missing data and will actually treat this line as a case (which in turn would affect the results), you should use <link xlink:href="d2c5ca2f-7323-41a3-9b7e-da917c99f0c4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Clean Missing Values</link> to check for missing values (particularly rows that are completely empty), and remove them as needed.

trans-unit.source: Before you check for empty rows, you might also want to divide the dataset by using <link xlink:href="70530644-c97a-4ab6-85f7-88bf30a8be5f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Split</link>.
trans-unit.target: Before you check for empty rows, you might also want to divide the dataset by using <link xlink:href="70530644-c97a-4ab6-85f7-88bf30a8be5f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Split</link>.

trans-unit.source: This separates rows with partial missing values, which represent actual missing values in the source data.
trans-unit.target: This separates rows with partial missing values, which represent actual missing values in the source data.

trans-unit.source: Use the <ui>Select head N rows</ui> option to read the first part of the dataset into a separate container from the last line.
trans-unit.target: Use the <ui>Select head N rows</ui> option to read the first part of the dataset into a separate container from the last line.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>How does <ui>Reader</ui> load data from across geographical regions</embeddedLabel>?
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>How does <ui>Reader</ui> load data from across geographical regions</embeddedLabel>?

trans-unit.source: If the storage account is in a different region from the compute node, data access will be slower.
trans-unit.target: If the storage account is in a different region from the compute node, data access will be slower.

trans-unit.source: Further, there will be charges for data ingress and egress on the subscription if the compute node is in a different region than the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Further, there will be charges for data ingress and egress on the subscription if the compute node is in a different region than the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Why do I get an error message similar to “Type Decimal is not supported”?
trans-unit.target: Why do I get an error message similar to “Type Decimal is not supported”?

trans-unit.source: When reading data from some sources, such as a SQL database in Azure, you might encounter an error message similar to “Type Decimal is not supported.”
trans-unit.target: When reading data from some sources, such as a SQL database in Azure, you might encounter an error message similar to “Type Decimal is not supported.”

trans-unit.source: This message is reporting an unsupported data type.
trans-unit.target: This message is reporting an unsupported data type.

trans-unit.source: If data from a SQL database includes data types that are not supported in Azure Machine Learning, you should cast or convert the decimals to a supported data before reading the data.
trans-unit.target: If data from a SQL database includes data types that are not supported in Azure Machine Learning, you should cast or convert the decimals to a supported data before reading the data.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Reader</ui> cannot automatically perform any conversions that would result in a loss of precision.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Reader</ui> cannot automatically perform any conversions that would result in a loss of precision.

trans-unit.source: For more information about supported data types, see <link xlink:href="9cfd19ab-5ddd-4810-82a5-0a299fca1372" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Data types</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about supported data types, see <link xlink:href="9cfd19ab-5ddd-4810-82a5-0a299fca1372" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Data types</link>.

trans-unit.source: Why are some characters in my source file not displayed correctly in the header?
trans-unit.target: Why are some characters in my source file not displayed correctly in the header?

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning generally supports the UTF-8 encoding.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning generally supports the UTF-8 encoding.

trans-unit.source: If your source file used another type of encoding, the characters might not be imported correctly.
trans-unit.target: If your source file used another type of encoding, the characters might not be imported correctly.

trans-unit.source: If you have trouble loading data correctly, try using the option <ui>CSV with encoding</ui> and specify parameters for custom delimiters, the code page, and so forth.
trans-unit.target: If you have trouble loading data correctly, try using the option <ui>CSV with encoding</ui> and specify parameters for custom delimiters, the code page, and so forth.

trans-unit.source: Exceptions
trans-unit.target: Exceptions

trans-unit.source: Exception
trans-unit.target: Exception

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: An exception occurs when two objects have to be the same size, but they are not.
trans-unit.target: An exception occurs when two objects have to be the same size, but they are not.

trans-unit.source: An exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.
trans-unit.target: An exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.

trans-unit.source: An exception occurs when an invalid URI is passed.
trans-unit.target: An exception occurs when an invalid URI is passed.

trans-unit.source: an exception occurs in when it is not possible to download a file.
trans-unit.target: an exception occurs in when it is not possible to download a file.

trans-unit.source: An exception occurs if one or more parameters could not be parsed or converted from the specified type to the type required by the target method.
trans-unit.target: An exception occurs if one or more parameters could not be parsed or converted from the specified type to the type required by the target method.

trans-unit.source: An exception occurs if the Azure storage account name or the container name is specified incorrectly.
trans-unit.target: An exception occurs if the Azure storage account name or the container name is specified incorrectly.

trans-unit.source: An exception occurs when it is not possible to open a file.
trans-unit.target: An exception occurs when it is not possible to open a file.

trans-unit.source: An exception occurs if the database connection has failed.
trans-unit.target: An exception occurs if the database connection has failed.

trans-unit.source: An exception occurs when it is not possible to create a directory on specified path.
trans-unit.target: An exception occurs when it is not possible to create a directory on specified path.

trans-unit.source: An exception occurs when it is not possible to parse a file.
trans-unit.target: An exception occurs when it is not possible to parse a file.
